Description: Ostracon, fragment (two fragments - the smaller one comprising three pieces) of the body of a brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of sixteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, worn and smudged in places, the smaller fragment has remains of nine of the lines of text, containing an account of wine.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.111-112)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393210) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393210)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 123 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
